data.title: John Roper Esq. (abt.1470-1524)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for John Roper Esq. born abt. 1470 Eltham & St. Dunstan's, Kent, England died 1524 Etham, Kent, England including ancestors + descendants + 2 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
John Roper Esq.

Born about 1470 in Eltham & St. Dunstan's, Kent, England

Ancestors

Son of John Roper and Margery (Tattersall) Roper

[sibling(s) unknown]

Husband of Jane (Fineux) Roper — married [date unknown] [location unknown]

Descendants

Died 7 Apr 1524 at about age 54 in Etham, Kent, England [uncertain]

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 26 Jun 2022 | Created 15 May 2012

This page has been accessed 6,572 times.

Biography

The Birth Date is a rough estimate. See the text for details.

John Roper, Esq., Attorney-General for King Henry VIII was born circa 1450 at Eltham & St. Dunstan's, Kent, England.[1]

John Roper, Esq. was the Attorney-General for King Henry VIII Protonotary of the King's Bench.[2]

He married Jane Fineaux, daughter of Sir John Fineaux, Lord Chief Justice of England and Elizabeth Appulderfield.[2][3]

He died on 7 April 1524.

The will of John Roper has been transcribed in Archaeologia Cantiana.[4] Made 27 January xv Henry VIII (1524) In it he mentions: Wife Jane Sons William (eldest), Edward (not yet 24), Christopher (youngest) Sir John Fineux, father to my saide wif Daughters Elizabeth, Agnes, Ellen, Margaret

Sources

↑ Douglas Richardson, Magna Carta Ancestry, 2nd Edition, Vol. III, p. 87.

↑ 2.0 2.1 Douglas Richardson, Magna Carta Ancestry, 2nd Edition, Vol. I, p. 15.

↑ Douglas Richardson, Royal Ancestry, Vol. I, p. 125.

↑ pages 153-174 https://www.kentarchaeology.org.uk/arch-cant/vol/2/archbishop-warhams-letters

See also:

Marlyn Lewis

THE PEERAGE 340397

Buckler, Benjamin. Stemmata Chicheleana (Oxford Clarendon Press, Oxford, 1765) Page 15.
